message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.SE, cs.IT, cs.CY 

The paper discusses the use of fingerprinting techniques to detect physical attacks on sensors in Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS) related to water treatment and distribution. This involves evaluating the feasibility of using fingerprinting techniques in the context of Industrial Control Systems, which falls under the category of systems and control (cs.SY). The paper also discusses the use of challenge-response protocols to expose cyber-attacks, which falls under the category of cryptography and security (cs.CR). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of noise patterns in hardware manufacturing to uniquely identify sensors, which falls under the category of information theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the difficulty of direct access to critical systems, which falls under the category of software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper discusses the application of fingerprinting techniques in mainstream IT systems such as PCs, laptops, and smartphones, which falls under the category of cybernetics (cs.CY).
